intro: Phacelia scabrella, commonly known as the rough phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in the spring and early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Phacelia scabrella is also valued as a nectar source for pollinators like bees and butterflies.
